Detailed Description

Header file for game parse functions responsible for parsing text and carrying out necessary functions.

void parseAddItems ( Inventory &  inventory,
string &  s 
)

Will parse the textfile tags and add all items when encountering addItem::itemName#

Parameters:
inventory The player's current inventory
s The screen buffer display string that will eventually be displayed

temporary string for use

indexes

finished searching the textfile for items? 0 - initially searching for items 1 - all items were found -> set to "true" finished searching

while loop to store text file in 's' string variable

find the index of (#)addItem::itemName#

no more items to find - stop searching

find the index of addItem::itemName(#)

get substring addItem#(itemName)#

check if the item is already in the inventory if the item isn't already in inventory then add it

since you just found and added an item at index 'i1' continue searching the textfile for more items after index 'i2'

void parseConditionalMove ( Inventory &  inventory,
optionsStruct &  options,
string &  s 
)

Will parse the textfile tags and add conditional movement options to the player's choice menu. This option will only be available if the player has a certain item in their inventory ItemName# is the name of the item to check for in the inventory Area.txt# is the area that will be the next loaded area Print this text# will be printed out to the screen movementIfItem::ItemName::Area::Print this text#

Parameters:
inventory The player's current inventory
options A reference to the options structure (player choices are added here)
s The screen buffer display string that will eventually be displayed

if have "ItemName" in inventory this is a movement option else there will be no movement option movementIfItem::ItemName::Area::Print this text#

temporary string for use

indexes

finished searching the textfile for items? 0 - initially searching for items 1 - all items were found -> set to "true" finished searching

find index of (#)movementIfItem::ItemName::Area::Print this text#

find index of movementIfItem(#)ItemName::Area::Print this text#

find index of movementIfItem::ItemName(#)Area::Print this text#

find index of movementIfItem::ItemName::Area(#)Print this text#

find index of movementIfItem::ItemName::Area::Print this text(#)

no more checks to find - stop searching

get itemName substring

get area name substring

delete last #

make it an option

delete the option and text completely

Will parse the textfile tags and conditionally display text ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this text#

Parameters:

s The screen buffer display string that will eventually be displayed

temporary string for use

indexes

finished searching the textfile for items? 0 - initially searching for items 1 - all items were found -> set to "true" finished searching

finds all the ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this# conditionals and modifies the display string 's' for the game screen

find the index of (#)ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this#

no more checks to find - stop searching

find the index of ifHaveItem::itemName(#)Print this#

get substring ifHaveItem#(itemName)Print this#

find the index of ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this(#)

check if the item is already in the inventory if the item is in inventory Print this# and remove ifHaveItem::itemName#

else remove everything ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this#

erases ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this(#)

erases (ifHaveItem::itemName#)Print this

completely remove ifHaveItem::itemName::Print this#

void parseTakeAction ( Inventory &  inventory,
optionsStruct &  options,
string &  s 
)

Will parse the textfile tags and add action options to the player's choice menu these actions can only be done once and will never be displayed again for the player ActionName# is the name of the action that will be printed out to the screen Print this text# will be printed out to the screen takeAction::ActionName::Print this text#

Parameters:
inventory The player's current inventory
options A reference to the options structure (player choices are added here)
s The screen buffer display string that will eventually be displayed

takeAction::actionName::Print this# this also goes into the inventory its a bit strange that actions like 'jumping' can go into the inventory

finds all the takeAction::actionName::Print this# conditionals

find the index of (#)takeAction::actionName::Print this#

no more checks to find - stop searching

find the index of takeAction::actionName(#)Print this#

get substring takeAction#(actionName)Print this#

find the index of takeAction::actionName::Print this(#)

check if the item is already in the inventory if the item is in inventory Print this# and remove takeAction::actionName#

else remove everything takeAction::actionName::Print this#

completely remove takeAction::actionName::Print this#

find the index of takeAction::actionName(#)Print this#

find the index of takeAction::actionName::Print this(#)

erase (movement::Area#)Print this(#)

erases takeAction::actionName::Print this(#)
